attributes.action: We call upon for a No Confidence Motion in Parliament against Boris Johson.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite many open challenges, Boris Johnson continued to deceive the general public by fraudulent intended misinformation campaign during the BREXIT referendum and causing harm to general public and tarnish UK image across the world.

The claim of £ 350 mil payment by UK tax payers to EU is unfounded. When Micheal Gove was challenged, he was not confident but proposed to have an audit after the referendum.
attributes.background:
The BREXIT referendum was won by leave campaigners based on DECEPTIVE facts such as £350 mil payment weekly to EU by Boris Johnson. 

These are intended misinformation to deceive public by those holding position of trust and responsibilities in public office.

rejection.details: We can't accept this petition because it asks for something that neither the House of Commons nor the Government can do. The expression "vote of no confidence" is used when talking about a vote in the House of Commons which tests whether or not the Government of the day has the confidence of a majority of MPs in the House of Commons. That's why we allow petitions asking for a vote of no confidence in the Government or in individual Ministers. The concept of the House having “confidence” in someone does not apply to MPs who are not acting as Ministers.
